Table.SCRIPT: Every night we go through a sleep-wake [{cycle}]. The first part of the cycle is slow-wave sleep. In this [{stage}] the body relaxes. The second stage is REM (Rapid Eye Movement) sleep. In this stage, the brain becomes active and we experience dreaming. The brain also [{gets rid of}] unimportant [{information}]. The body and mind are reset and [{refreshed}] while we sleep. Our bodies grow tissue and repair [{muscles}]. The [{immune system}] is also strengthened while we sleep. It’s important to try to sleep for eight hours every night.
Table.TITLE: The Science of Sleep
